comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From cnparm.home.texas.net/Wars/Marne/MarneBios.htm "Michel Joseph Maunoury (1847-1923) - Commander of French 6th Army, 1914-1915. Calm, courteous, and dependable; long military career. In Aug.1914, he briefly commanded the newly forming Army of Lorraine, which was transferred to the French left wing to defend Paris and redesignated the 6th Army. Maunoury was involved in desperate fighting in the Battle of the Marne, Sep.1914; was seriously wounded in 1915 and retired."

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your research swanq.  We'll add more information about Maunoury to the record the next time we update.
